DOCNAME: CASE OF GEORGI GEORGIEV v. BULGARIA
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . The applicant worked as a stoker at the FAC port . In DATE he was dismissed as new requirements he did not meet were introduced for his position .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant brought an action for unfair dismissal alleging that : CARDINAL ) the dismissal order had not been reasoned ; CARDINAL ) it had been indicated in it that it had been effective as of DATE when it had been issued ; and CARDINAL ) it had not been necessary to change the requirements for his position .
CARDINAL . In a judgment of ORG of DATE , upheld by ORG on DATE , the applicant 's dismissal was found to be unlawful .
CARDINAL . Upon appeal by the applicant 's former employer , in a judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG quashed ORG judgment , finding that the latter had misapplied the law .
CARDINAL . Following a fresh examination of the case , on DATE ORG delivered a new judgment whereby it dismissed the applicant 's claim .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed in cassation .

CARDINAL . ORG held a hearing to examine the applicant 's appeal on DATE . In a final judgment of CARDINAL DATE it upheld ORG judgment and dismissed the applicant 's arguments in respect of the alleged unlawfulness of the dismissal order , finding that : CARDINAL ) the order indicated the legal ground for the applicant 's dismissal , namely that he did not meet the relevant requirements ; this represented sufficient reasoning in the case ; CARDINAL ) the order had entered into force on the date it had been served on him , any other date indicated in it as a date of entry into force was irrelevant ; and CARDINAL ) the applicant 's former employer had enjoyed discretion , which could not be subject to judicial review , to set the requirements for the applicant 's position .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE and DATE the applicant requested ORG , where the case file was to be archived , for copies of all court judgments in the case . According to him , ORG refused to provide him with a copy of the judgment of ORG of DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . Nevertheless , the applicant has enclosed a copy of the said judgment with his application .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW of DATE provides that where an employee considers that he had been unfairly dismissed , he can bring an action to challenge the lawfulness of the dismissal . By LAW , such an action is to be filed with the respective district court , who must examine it within DATE . Where the district court 's decision has been appealed against , the respective regional court must examine the appeal within DATE of its lodging .
